==Events==
*  [[41]] &ndash; After a night of negotiation, [[Claudius]] is accepted as [[Roman Emperor]] by the [[Roman Senate|Senate]].
*  [[750]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of the Zab]], the [[Abbasid]] rebels defeat the [[Umayyad Caliphate]], leading to overthrow of the dynasty.
*[[1348]] &ndash; A [[1348 Friuli earthquake|strong earthquake]] strikes the South Alpine region of [[Friuli]] in modern [[Italy]], causing considerable damage to buildings as far away as [[Rome]].
*[[1494]] &ndash; [[Alfonso II of Naples|Alfonso II]] becomes King of [[Naples]].
*[[1515]] &ndash; [[Coronation of the French monarch|Coronation]] of [[Francis I of France]].
*[[1533]] &ndash; [[Henry VIII of England]] secretly marries his second wife [[Anne Boleyn]].
*[[1554]] &ndash; Founding of [[São Paulo (city)|São Paulo]] city, [[Brazil]].
*[[1573]] &ndash; [[Battle of Mikatagahara]]: In [[Japan]], [[Takeda Shingen]] defeats [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]].
*[[1575]] &ndash; [[Luanda]], the capital of [[Angola]], is founded by the Portuguese navigator [[Paulo Dias de Novais]].
*[[1704]] &ndash; The [[Apalachee massacre|Battle of Ayubale]] results in the destruction of most of the [[Spanish missions in Florida]].
*[[1755]] &ndash; [[Moscow State University|Moscow University]] is established on [[Tatiana Day]].
*[[1765]] &ndash; [[Port Egmont]], the first British settlement in the [[Falkland Islands]] at the southern tip of [[South America]], is founded.
*[[1787]] &ndash; [[Shays' Rebellion]]: The rebellion's largest confrontation, outside the [[Springfield Armory]], results in the killing of four rebels and the wounding of twenty.
*[[1791]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of Great Britain|British Parliament]] passes the [[Constitutional Act of 1791]] and splits the old [[Province of Quebec (1763–1791)|Province of Quebec]] into [[Upper Canada|Upper]] and [[Lower Canada]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; The [[London Corresponding Society]] is founded.
*[[1858]] &ndash; The ''[[Wedding March (Mendelssohn)|Wedding March]]'' by [[Felix Mendelssohn]] is played at the marriage of [[Victoria of the United Kingdom|Queen Victoria]]'s daughter, [[Victoria, Princess Royal and Empress Frederick|Victoria]], and [[Friedrich III of Germany (Hohenzollern)|Friedrich of Prussia]], and becomes a popular wedding recessional.
*[[1879]] &ndash; The [[Bulgarian National Bank]] is founded.
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]] and [[Alexander Graham Bell]] form the [[Oriental Telephone Company]].
*[[1890]] &ndash; [[Nellie Bly]] completes her round-the-world journey in 72 days.
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Richard Strauss]]'s opera ''[[Elektra (opera)|Elektra]]'' receives its debut performance at the [[Semperoper|Dresden State Opera]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Alexander Graham Bell]] inaugurates U.S. transcontinental telephone service, speaking from New York to [[Thomas A. Watson|Thomas Watson]] in San Francisco.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Ukraine]] declares independence from [[Bolshevik]] [[Russia]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[League of Nations]] is founded.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[1924 Winter Olympics]] opens in [[Chamonix]], in the [[France|French]] [[Alps]], inaugurating the [[Winter Olympic Games]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: The [[Republic of China|Chinese]] [[National Revolutionary Army]] [[Defense of Harbin|begins its defense]] of [[Harbin]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; ''[[The Guiding Light]]'' debuts on NBC radio from Chicago. In 1952 it moves to CBS television, where it remains until Sept. 18, 2009.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius XII]] elevates the [[Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands]] to the dignity of a [[diocese]]. It becomes the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Thailand]] declares war on the [[United States]] and [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Florence Li Tim-Oi]] is ordained in China, becoming the first woman Anglican priest.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of the Bulge]] ends.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[United Mine Workers]] rejoins the [[American Federation of Labor]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Thomas T. Goldsmith, Jr.|Thomas Goldsmith Jr.]] files a patent for a "[[Cathode Ray Tube]] Amusement Device", the first ever electronic game.
*[[1949]] &ndash; At the Hollywood Athletic Club the first [[Emmy Award]]s are presented.
*[[1955]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] ends the state of war with Germany.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[National Association of Broadcasters]] reacts to the "[[payola]]" scandal by threatening fines for any [[disc jockey]]s who accept money for playing particular records.
*[[1961]] &ndash; In [[Washington, D.C.]] [[John F. Kennedy]] delivers the first live [[President of the United States|presidential]] television [[news conference]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Brazilian Army]] captain [[Carlos Lamarca]] deserts in order to fight against the [[Brazilian military government|military dictatorship]], taking with him 10 machine guns and 63 rifles.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Charles Manson]] and three female "Family" members are found guilty of the 1969 [[Tate-LaBianca murders]].
*  1971   &ndash; [[Idi Amin]] leads a [[1971 Ugandan coup d'état|coup]] deposing [[Milton Obote]] and becomes [[Uganda]]'s president.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] starts his first official papal visits outside Italy to the [[Bahamas]], [[Dominican Republic]] and [[Mexico]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Mother Teresa]] is honored with India's highest civilian award, the [[Bharat Ratna]]
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Jiang Qing]], the widow of [[Mao Zedong]], is sentenced to death.
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[National Resistance Movement]] topples the government of [[Tito Okello]] in [[Uganda]].
*[[1990]] [[Avianca Flight 52]] crashed into [[Cove Neck]], New York due to fuel exuasion.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[1993 CIA shootings|Five people are shot outside]] the [[CIA]] headquarters in [[Langley, Virginia]]. Two are killed and three wounded.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Clementine mission|Clementine]] space probe launches.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Norwegian rocket incident]]: [[Russia]] almost launches a [[nuclear weapon|nuclear]] attack after it mistakes [[Black Brant (rocket)|Black Brant XII]], a [[Norway|Norwegian]] research rocket, for a US [[Trident]] missile.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Billy Bailey]] becomes the last person to be hanged in the USA.
*[[1998]] &ndash; During a historic visit to Cuba, [[Pope John Paul II]] demands political reforms and the release of political prisoners while condemning US attempts to isolate the country.
*  1998   &ndash; A suicide attack by the [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] on [[Sri Lanka]]'s [[Temple of the Tooth]] kills eight and injures 25 others.
*[[1999]] &ndash; A 6.0 [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]] [[1999 Armenia, Colombia earthquake|earthquake]] hits western [[Colombia]] killing at least 1,000.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[2003 Invasion of Iraq]]: A group of people leave [[London]], [[England]], for [[Baghdad]], [[Iraq]], to [[Human shield action to Iraq|serve as human shields]], intending to prevent the [[United States|U.S.]]-led [[coalition of the willing|coalition]] troops from bombing certain locations.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Opportunity rover]] (MER-B) lands on surface of [[Mars]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; A [[Mandher Devi temple stampede|stampede]] at the [[Mandhradevi]] temple in [[Maharashtra]], [[India]] kills at least 258.
*[[2006]] &ndash; Three independent observing campaigns announce the discovery of [[OGLE-2005-BLG-390Lb]] through [[gravitational microlensing]], the first cool rocky/icy [[extrasolar planet]] around a main-sequence star.
*  2006   &ndash; [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[lucha libre|professional wrestler]] [[Juana Barraza]] is arrested in connection with the [[serial killer|serial killing]] of at least 10 elderly women.
*[[2011]] &ndash; The [[Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Hosni Mubarak's rule|first wave]] of the [[2011 Egyptian revolution|Egyptian revolution]] begins in [[Egypt]], with a series of street demonstrations, marches, rallies, acts of civil disobedience, riots, labour strikes, and violent clashes in [[Cairo]], [[Alexandria]], and throughout other cities in Egypt.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 50 people are killed and 120 people are injured in a [[2013 Uribana prison riot|prison riot]] in [[Barquisimeto]], [[Venezuela]].
